title: Oregon Firm Recalls Meat and Poultry Ravioli Products Produced Without Benefit of Inspection
summary: WASHINGTON, September 16, 2013 Siberoni, a Portland, Ore. firm, is recalling 169,655 pounds of raw and frozen meat and poultry ipelmeni” (Eastern European-style ravioli products) which were produced without the benefit of inspection, the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced...
impacted_products: 1 lb. packages, in 40 pound cases, of “Siberoni” brand Chicken Pelmeni
1 lb. packages, in 40 pound cases, of “Siberoni” brand Beef Pelmeni
1 lb. packages, in 40 pound cases, of “Siberoni” brand Beef and Pork Pelmeni
